intro: Bumelia crenulata, commonly known as the smooth bumelia, is a deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its alternate, ovate leaves with smooth margins and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Bumelia crenulata is often found in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and in woodlands.
